page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: There used to be a Roman road which passed through modern day Cambridge. It went from Aust to Gloucester. Changes in the last forty years include the river Cam being widened, the A38 road being sunk twice, and the M5 being built.The A road declined in importance when the M5 was built but in the last few years the traffic has mounted up again. Although the area being surveyed is predominantly rural there is still quite a lot of transport. The A38 cuts right through the area, through Cambridge and past Gossington.The M5 motorway runs through the area running roughly parallel to the A38.The main railway line passes through the South of the area,running under the motorway and A38.There is also the A4135 which branches off the A38 to Dursley.
